summary: Nine formal groups within the Department of Homeland Security routinely share information to advise leaders, guide internal policies, and identify potential threats. We found no unnecessary duplication among the groups, but some of their purposes and activities had the potential for overlap. Agency officials said groups collaborate to avoid duplication. title: Homeland Security: DHS Internal Entities Facilitate Information Sharing in Key Areas and Collaborate as Needed
